pros: The pros of this job is that you get to help people
cons: There is never no cons in helping people.

review_title: Pays great, atmosphere stressfull and caddy.
pros: They have one of the best pay scales in the valley. The union offers protection and fairness. I like the freedom of 12 hour shifts.
cons: The coworkers are very caddy and it does not feel like a professional enviroment. Some of the leadership plays favorites and gosips. They do not offer a good in house education oppertunities. Lack of advanced technology. It's very hard to get a day off approved. The residents need to be monitored by nursing for mistakes. The doctors are overly needy and demanding.

review_title: Felt like a fish out of water
pros: Excellent benefits packages.  Very quick on-boarding process.  Hospital is trying to improve appearance and update the look of common areas.
cons: Supervisors did not give any guidance.  I was impressed with the concept of wanting to make Easton Hospital a place where people loved to come to work; however, it was clearly only a concept.  I would have liked to see that way of thinking adopted by the employees.

review_title: Pharmacy Technician Easton Hospital Easton, PA
pros: Easton hospital provides a nice small working environment. From my experience, lower management is very concerned with employee satisfaction, a listens to our opinions on what we think will make a more productive department.
cons: They place too much emphasis on minimizing staff. Even though it saves the compan money, patient care should not suffer due to the lack of staff.

review_title: pharmacist point of view on the pharmacy culture
pros: generally slow tempo of workload as compared to other hospital pharmacies
cons: bullying, use of abusive language by some technicians, management does not solve personnel problems, female employees form cliques, technicians do not perform their duties as they should - everyone cuts corners.  pharmacist are reluctant to accept new/additional duties, such as clinical duties
Extremely poor administrative leadership that and unstable CEO position

pros: Benefits package is good if you’re a full time employe. Some of the people are ok. Less people to deal with on night shift.
cons: Scheduling sucks if you work nights. Training isn’t the greatest. Training for nights was basically non existent then Day shift will Nag to you about everything.

pros: Pay is decent for Lehigh valley area
cons: Poorly managed emergency department. Always short-staffed. Staff is stressed due to high demands. Don't expect to get a break.

pros: Coworkers very nice, 401K match by company 3%/6%.
cons: Bad healthcare benefits package, salaries inconsistent, cafeteria food awful.

pros: Great people. Staff truly cares about their patients. Offer many of the same services of the other local mega-hospitals, but with a more personal approach.
cons: Management needs to consider what really matters versus the fluff.

pros: There are no pros working in this hospital.  Hospital is only out for money.  Best advise go to a different hospital for service
cons: Managers are not good.  They have there favorites. To much favoritism people have there clicks. No room for advancement.  I advise not to get s job here

pros: great benefits.  flexible work schedule.  good coworkers
cons: lower than average salary.  owned by a for profit corporation that micromanages all aspects of day to day activities

pros: the benefits and co-workers are the only reason to stay
cons: corporate mandates and budget cuts are a problem
salary cap for long term employees.no cost of living rise
